title: torch.Tensor not creating tensor on cuda
body_html:
🐛 Bug

torch.Tensor is creating tensor only on CPU. The device argument isn't working

To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

Expected behavior

torch.Tensor should create tensor on cuda:0 device

Environment

Google Colaboratory + Python 3 + GPU

Collecting environment information...
PyTorch version: 0.4.1
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: 9.0.176

OS: Ubuntu 17.10
GCC version: (Ubuntu 7.2.0-8ubuntu3.2) 7.2.0
CMake version: Could not collect

Python version: 3.6
Is CUDA available: Yes
CUDA runtime version: Could not collect
GPU models and configuration: GPU 0: Tesla K80
Nvidia driver version: 384.111
cuDNN version: Could not collect

Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip] Could not collect
[conda] Could not collect

body: ## 🐛 Bug `torch.Tensor` is creating tensor only on CPU. The `device` argument isn't working ## To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior: ## Expected behavior `torch.Tensor` should create tensor on `cuda:0` device ## Environment Google Colaboratory + Python 3 + GPU Collecting environment information... PyTorch version: 0.4.1 Is debug build: No CUDA used to build PyTorch: 9.0.176 OS: Ubuntu 17.10 GCC version: (Ubuntu 7.2.0-8ubuntu3.2) 7.2.0 CMake version: Could not collect Python version: 3.6 Is CUDA available: Yes CUDA runtime version: Could not collect GPU models and configuration: GPU 0: Tesla K80 Nvidia driver version: 384.111 cuDNN version: Could not collect Versions of relevant libraries: [pip] Could not collect [conda] Could not collect
